alert.note: Alert for Cheatham; Davidson; Dickson; Robertson; Rutherford; Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 1:12PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Davidson, northeastern Dickson, northeastern Marshall, Rutherford, Williamson, Cheatham, northwestern Bedford and southwestern Robertson Counties through 200 PM CDT... At 112 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Burns to near Lewisburg. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Murfreesboro, Franklin, Springfield, Ashland City, Nashville, Madison, Smyrna, Brentwood, La Vergne, Spring Hill, Goodlettsville, Greenbrier, Nolensville, Forest Hills, Oak Hill, Coopertown, Belle Meade, Kingston Springs, Thompson`s Station and Pegram. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 185 and 221. Interstate 65 between mile markers 54 and 95. Interstate 24 between mile markers 22 and 92. Interstate 840 between mile markers 27 and 60. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Cheatham; Davidson; Dickson; Robertson; Rutherford; Williamson
